com.scaleoutsoftware.soss.cache

Class ScaleoutCache<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scaleoutsoftware.soss.cache.ScaleoutCache<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the key type
    V - the value type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Iterable<javax.cache.Cache.Entry<K,V>>, javax.cache.Cache<K,V>

    public class ScaleoutCache<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.cache.Cache<K,V>

    The ScaleoutCache is an implementation of the JSR107 Cache interface. This implementation stores key/value pairs inside ScaleOut StateServer.

    The namespace used by SOSS is configured through the ScaleoutCacheManager.getCache(String) method.

    By default, the ScaleOutCache stores Serializable keys and values. You can control the serialization strategy by setting properties on the Properties provided by the CachingProvider. i.e., 

    
     CachingProvider provider = new ScaleoutCachingProvider();
     Properties props = provider.getDefaultProperties();
     props.setProperty("...", "...");
     props.setProperty("...", "...");
     CacheManager manager = provider.getCacheManager(provider.getDefaultURI(), provider.getDefaultClassLoader(), props);

    property name: cache_key_serializer default value: none

    property name: cache_value_serializer default value: none

    property name: object_expiration_timeout_secs default value: none

    property name: object_expiration_timeout_policy default value: absolute

    All ScaleoutCache operations can throw a CacheException and the underlying exception may be specific to ScaleOut StateServer (SOSS). The Javadoc for the SOSS Java APIs describes the underlying exceptions in detail. For example, SOSS configuration exceptions are specific to SOSS and thrown as a CacheException.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public V get(K key)
      throws javax.cache.CacheException,
             java.lang.IllegalStateException,
             java.lang.NullPointerException

        Attempts to retrieve a value from this Cache. If the Cache contains a entry for this key then the associated value is returned otherwise null is returned.

        If Cache.isClosed() returns true then an IllegalStateException is thrown. If the parameter key is null then a NullPointerException is thrown. If ScaleOut StateServer is unavailable, then a CacheException is thrown. If the configured value type does not match the value type of the object stored inside the Cache then a ClassCastException is thrown.

        Specified by:
        get in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to find the key/value entry stored in the NamedCache
        Returns:
        the value associated with the parameter key, or null
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs during retrieval, serialization of the user's key, or deserialization of the user's object
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cache is closed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key is null

      • getAll

        public java.util.Map<K,V> getAll(java.util.Set<? extends K> set)
                          throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                                 java.lang.NullPointerException

        Retrieves a map of key/value pairs for the parameter set of keys.

        If a key does not have an associated value then no entry will exist in the returned map.

        Specified by:
        getAll in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        set - the set of keys to retrieve
        Returns:
        a Map of Key/Value pairs
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs during retrieval, serialization of the user's key, or deserialization of the user's object
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if a key in the set is null

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(K key)
                    throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                           java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           java.lang.NullPointerException

        Checks to see if the Cache contains an entry for the parameter key.

        NOTE: the underlying repository for this JSR107 implementation is a distributed NamedCache. Therefore, another client (or another thread in this application) could create/update or remove/clear the key AFTER this operation completes. Therefore, the result should not be treated as authoritative.

        Specified by:
        containsKey in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to find the key/value entry stored in the NamedCache
        Returns:
        true/false if a key/value entry exists
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs during serialization of the user's key or connectivity with the ScaleOut StateServer store.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Cache is closed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key is null

      • loadAll

        public void loadAll(java.util.Set<? extends K> set,
                    boolean replaceExistingValues,
                    javax.cache.integration.CompletionListener completionListener)
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

        Load all is not implemented and will throw an UnsupportedOperationException if the Cache is not closed.

        Specified by:
        loadAll in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        set - the keys to load from the backing store
        replaceExistingValues - if true, the values are replaced, if false, the cached value is maintained
        completionListener - used to mark completion of the load operation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Cache is closed
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - this operation is not supported

         throws javax.cache.CacheException,

        Associates the specified value with the specified key in the Cache.

        If the associated key/value pair already exists, then the entry is updated with the parameter value.

        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Cache is closed

      • getAndPut

        public V getAndPut(K key,
                   V value)
            throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                   java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                   java.lang.NullPointerException

        Associates the specified value with the specified key in this Cache, returning an existing value if one existed.

        If the cache previously contained a entry for the parameter key, the previous value will be returned. If no value previously existed then null will be returned.

        Specified by:
        getAndPut in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to find the associated value
        value - the value to put associate with the parameter key
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the parameter key, or null
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs during get or put, during serialization of the user's key or value, or during deserialization of the users stored value
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Cache is closed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key or value is null

      • remove

        public boolean remove(K key,
                      V value)
               throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.lang.NullPointerException

        Removes the key/value pair from the Cache if the parameter value matches the retrieved value.

        NOTE: Returns false if the key has no associated value.

        NOTE: Equality is determined using the Object.equals(Object) method.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to remove a key/value entry in this cache
        value - the expected value in the cache
        Returns:
        true if the key/value entry was removed, false if the object doesn't exist or the expected value doesn't match the retrieved value
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs during removal or serialization of the user's key or value
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cache is closed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key or value is null

      • replace

        public boolean replace(K key,
                       V oldValue,
                       V newValue)
                throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                       java.lang.NullPointerException

        Replaces a key/value pair with a new value if the current cached value is identical to the parameter value.

        NOTE: Equality is determined using the Object.equals(Object) method.

        Specified by:
        replace in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use to find the existing key/value entry
        oldValue - the old value to compare the existing value with
        newValue - the new value to update the existing value with
        Returns:
        true/false if the entry was updated or false if the entry is unchanged -- null, or oldValue != cachedValue
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs while retrieving or updating the entry, or serialization of the user's key/value, or deserialization of the user's value
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cache is closed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key or values are null

      • replace

        public boolean replace(K key,
                       V value)
                throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                       java.lang.NullPointerException

        Replaces the value of a key/value pair stored in the Cache.

        If the key/value pair doesn't exist in the Cache then the key/value pair won't be added to the Cache.

        Specified by:
        replace in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        key - the key to use for finding the existing key/value entry
        value - the value used to replace the existing value
        Returns:
        true if the existing value was updated with the new value, false if no key/value entry existed
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs while retrieving or updating the entry, or serialization of the user's key/value, or deserialization of the user's value
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cache is closed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key or value is null

                throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                       java.lang.NullPointerException

        Gets a key/value pair entry and replaces the value.

        If the key/value entry doesn't exist, then the new key/value entry is not created.

        Specified by:
        getAndReplace in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:

        value - the value used to replace the existing value
        Returns:

        Throws:

        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cache is closed
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key or value is null

      • registerCacheEntryListener

        public void registerCacheEntryListener(javax.cache.configuration.CacheEntryListenerConfiguration<K,V> cacheEntryListenerConfiguration)
                                throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                                       java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                       java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                                       java.lang.NullPointerException

        Registers a CacheEntryExpiredListener with this Cache. Expiration events are handled asynchronously by the implementation provided by the parameter CacheEntryListenerConfiguration.

        NOTE: this Cache implementation only supports CacheEntryExpiredListener and all other CacheEntryListenerConfiguration will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        NOTE: ScaleOut StateServer uses a scalable expiration model -- meaning expiration events are not necessarily handled by the application that registers the CacheEntryExpiredListener. More info on expiration events can be found in the ScaleOut StateServer help file.

        Specified by:
        registerCacheEntryListener in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        cacheEntryListenerConfiguration - the configuration used to create a CacheEntryListener
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs while registering an event listener
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cache is closed
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the configuration is for any event listener other than expiration events
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter configuration is null

      • deregisterCacheEntryListener

        public void deregisterCacheEntryListener(javax.cache.configuration.CacheEntryListenerConfiguration<K,V> cacheEntryListenerConfiguration)
                                  throws javax.cache.CacheException,
                                         java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

        Deregisters a CacheEntryExpiredListener from this Cache.

        NOTE: this Cache implementation only supports CacheEntryExpiredListener and all other CacheEntryListenerConfiguration will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        deregisterCacheEntryListener in interface javax.cache.Cache<K,V>
        Parameters:
        cacheEntryListenerConfiguration - the configuration used to deregister an event listener
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs while deregistering an event listener
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cache is closed
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the configuration is for any event listener other than expiration events
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter configuration is null

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<javax.cache.Cache.Entry<K,V>> iterator()
                                                          throws javax.cache.CacheException

        Returns an iterator of all key/value entries in this Cache.

        NOTE: all Iterator.next() method calls perform a full key/value entry retrieval.

        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        a lazy iterator for all key/value entries in this cache
        Throws:
        javax.cache.CacheException - if an exception occurs while iterating over the entries in the cache
